titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Peace subject collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lyalya Kharitonova.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-03-15T14:23-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: March 10, 2016: Extra descriptions to the sound recordings by Jim Sam August 6, 2012: Revised to update encoding by Samira Bozorgi

did.unittitle: Peace subject collection
did.langmaterial: In various languages: French, English, German, Italian, and Greek

physdesc.extent: 17 manuscript boxes, 5 oversize boxes, 4 compact sound cassettes

did.abstract: Pamphlets, clippings, leaflets, letters, memoranda, circulars, reports, and bulletins, relating to pacifism, disarmament, international law, the Paris Peace Conference of 1919, the League of Nations and other actual or proposed international organizations, and various proposed plans to ensure peace.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. Use copies of all sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Peace subject collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: League of Nations miscellany, Hoover Institution Archives
Herbert Hoover, the League of Nations and the World Court: typescript, Hoover Institution Archives
Christian Archibald Herter papers, Hoover Institution Archives
Malbone W. Graham papers, Hoover Institution Archives
Aleksandr Nikolaevich Krupenskiĭ papers, Hoover Institution Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection relates to pacifism, disarmament, international law, the Paris Peace Conference of 1919, the League of Nations and other actual or proposed international organizations, and various proposed plans to ensure peace. It consists of pamphlets, bulletins, leaflets, clippings, letters, memoranda, reports, circulars, scrapbooks, and audio recordings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in four series: Printed matter; Incremental material; Scrapbooks; and Sound recordings.

did.unittitle: PRINTED MATTER

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains pamphlets, brochures, booklets, and bulletins, mainly in French and German

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by author or by the title when author is unspecified, and chronologically thereunder
